Publication Order of Non-Fiction Books

About Robin S. Sharma

The Canadian self-help writer and motivational speaker Robin Sharma is well known for his inspirational work and writing. Speaking at various events and writing numerous books, he’s a leading voice within his industry, helping countless people around the world. Imparting a strong message through his words, he really delivers powerful ideas that have helped to lift up and elevate others. Knowing his audience well too, he delivers his work confidently and with precision, really allowing it to make a real strong impact.

Offering a number of powerful truths, he’s a spiritual thinker, delivering life messages, while also running his own company. As one of the most successful publishing franchises, he’s widely regarded all around the work for his many books and teachings. Training and teaching people to lead a better life, he also dedicates much of his time to philanthropy as well, being a spokesperson for his message. With ideas that are unique to him, he has something of his own to offer, as he communicates in a manner that is both direct and to the point.

Engaging readers and listeners, he has a compelling style and approach that immediately grabs people and doesn’t let go. Whether it’s in his books or at his events, he manages to put forwards a multitude of different ideas and lessons to live by. Many can testify to the changes he’s provided helping others, making him hugely successful for many people regardless of their background. With a lot more to come in the near future, he isn’t stopping any time soon either, as his writing career carries on growing from strength-to-strength.

Early and Personal Life

Born in 1964 on the 16th of July, Robin S. Sharma would grow up in Canada during the 1960s, coming to make a name for himself as an author. Developing his voice over the years, he would gradually learn his craft, whilst also becoming a confident speaker as well. Working as a litigation lawyer until he was twenty-five, he would then move on to become an author, as well as a motivational speaker.

Publishing his first book, he would publish it himself, and this would ultimately lead to his career, as he would become a successful writer full time. Founding the training company known as Sharma Leadership International, he’s gone on to successfully publish over twelve books and counting. Speaking at numerous corporate events for big names, including Microsoft and Nike, he continues to be a successful writer to this day.

Writing Career

In 1994 he would publish the book ‘Megaliving!: 30 Days to a Perfect Life,’ which would go on to become a resounding success. His second book, ‘The Monk Who Sold His Ferrari,’ would also be self-published in 1997, and would later be picked up by HarperCollins. Largely writing books on stress management as well as spirituality, he has helped countless others through his words and his work.

Often teaching on leadership and motivation, he inspires others to make the best of themselves, really taking his career to a new level each time. His writing has helped many and he does a lot of work through his foundation too, providing assistance and services to those in need. Acclaimed by both readers and critics alike, he’s won numerous awards, and his writing career continues on strong.

The Monk Who Sold His Ferrari

Originally published in 1996, this would come out through the HarperOne publishing label on the 21st of April to much acclaim. Self-published at first, it would later get a book deal, allowing him to become a huge name in the self-help genre and scene. Reaching a global audience, it would see Sharma becoming a success, and would set the tone for much of what was to follow.

Following Julian Mantle, this sees him as a lawyer confronting his own life, facing a spiritual imbalance and crisis. Journeying on an odyssey into an ancient culture, he begins to make discoveries that lead to him learning wise and fulfilling lessons. These truths help provide insight, advancing his life, and creating a sense of well-being, allowing him to lift himself up. Developing joyful thoughts, following life’s personal calling and mission, and acting courageously, he learns to make the most of everything.

Working as a fable essentially, this gives the reader plenty of life lessons through its engaging story and interesting premise. Providing the reader with a clear message, it gives them something concrete to take away, allowing them to really prosper. There would be other books similar to it as well from Sharma, but this would definitely set the benchmark for much of his writing career.

The Saint, the Surfer, and the CEO

First brought out in 2002 on the 1st of October, this would be another stand-alone self-help book from Robin S. Sharma. Released through the Hay House publishing label, it continued the career of Sharma with more of his insights and learning. Finding more fans around the world, it would incorporate a number of different ideas, essentially becoming its own complete book. There’s a lot to it, and many have found solace and comfort in what it has to say and offer the reader over the years.

This provides an in-depth guide and insight into living the best life, and really making the most of everything available. Teaching the reader, it takes them on a journey, allowing them to really benefit and live a far more fulfilling life in the process. Showing readers how to live their destiny, it helps them conquer stress and balance their life feeling good about themselves overall. This is something that really helps, offering practical wisdom in a straightforward and easy to follow manner.

It’s a well written resource with a lot to offer its audience, and fans of Sharma as a writer definitely won’t be disappointed. It’s practical and intelligently written, really allowing the reader to invest themselves in what’s being said to them directly. Anyone reading this will take something away from it, which goes some way towards explaining why it’s been so successful worldwide.
